url.title: The Knowledge Chamber
url.description: Join Robert Hess, as he meets with the developers, program managers, and others who are integral in the process of explaining Microsoft technologies to others. These episodes will primarily be lead-ups to the presentations at our MIX and PDC events, providing people with insights and details as to what some of these sessions will cover.

video:video.video:title: Into the Cloud with Windows Azure
video:video.video:description: Window Azure provides a quick, easy, and—more importantly—powerful way for companies of any size to take advantage of cloud based services. While lots of companies are already moving their&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Application Compatibility: The Inside Scoop
video:video.video:description: With every new version of Windows, there is a huge effort to make sure that applications that worked on the previous version continue to work as expected. For this episode, I've invited Chris Jackson&#8230;

video:video.video:title: C++: A Language for Modern Times
video:video.video:description: C&#43;&#43; has been around for what seems like forever. It might seem like it's taken a back seat to languages that provide better application isolation and better development throughput, but in&#8230;

video:video.video:title: An Introduction to Windows Azure
video:video.video:description: Windows Azure provides scalable data and processing resources for businesses of almost any size. Steve Fox and Paul Stubbs are going to be presenting a PreCon seminar at TechEd (&quot;Windows Azure&#8230;

video:video.video:title: User-Centric Application Delivery Rocks the World
video:video.video:description: Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager 2012 adds several new and exciting features which will radically change how software can be deployed to users in businesses of various sizes. Johan&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Sean McKenna and Windows Phone "Mango" Database Support

video:video.video:description: Windows Phone has proven to be a popular platform for developing a wide variety of applications. Clint Rutkas joins us on this episode to explain what &quot;Coding4Fun&quot; is, and how they help&#8230;

video:video.video:description: Andrew Clinick, Lead Program Manager for Windows Phone Developer Platform joins us today to discuss some of the features and capabilities that get him excited about helping developers build great&#8230;

video:video.video:description: When talking about developing applications for the new Windows Phone platform, we usually focus on Silverlight. There is, however, another programming model for developing Windows Phone applications,&#8230;

video:video.video:title: PDC10 and the new Online Experience
video:video.video:description: PDC10 is fast approaching, and if you’ve been paying attention, you know that things are different this year. While you might know that for the first time we will be holding it at our own conference&#8230;

video:video.video:description: One of the thorns in the sides of all Internet users is the plethora of accounts they need to keep track of for the various websites they use throughout the day. Most of the folks running these sites&#8230;

video:video.video:description: With just a short time to go before Windows Phone 7 hits the market, there is no time like the present to start developing your applications. Mike Harsh recently presented a session at MIX10 on&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Microsoft Research: Tools to Help Resolve Concurrency Problems
video:video.video:description: If you are developing multi-threaded applications, there is a possibility that you may be having concurrency problems, and these problems can be difficult to reproduce and identify.At PDC09, Madan&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Multi-Core and Parallel Programming Practices
video:video.video:description: In case you haven’t realized it, the new trend in computer chip technology is multi-core. This is where most of the speed improvements moving forward will come from on our computers. To take full&#8230;

video:video.video:title: PDC09 Workshop: Microsoft Technology Roadmap
video:video.video:description: For one of the day-long workshops at this years PDC, Michele Leroux Bustamante will be hosting a session where she'll walk attendees through a variety of Microsoft technologies and help them&#8230;

video:video.video:description: It can be easy to get caught up in all of the fancy graphics, transitions, and video effects that are part of Silverlight, but that doesn’t mean you can’t write serious, business ready, applications&#8230;

video:video.video:description: Many people love to speculate on what the next Killer App might be. Juval Lowy will use his ideal killer app as the basis of his upcoming workshop at PDC09 on November 16th. He’d like to think&#8230;

video:video.video:title: PDC09 Workshop: Developing Microsoft BI Applications - The How and The Why
video:video.video:description: BI, or &quot;Business Intelligence&quot; allows businesses to make better use of their data, and resources in order to make better decisions related to how to grow and improve their business. For the&#8230;

video:video.video:description:
While technically the PDC this year starts on November 17th, the day before that we will be hosting a set of day-long intensive workshops on several specific topics.

video:video.video:title: Chris Auld - PDC09 Architecting and Developing for Windows Azure

video:video.video:description: Not all Microsoft technologies and projects come out of large development teams with huge budgets and equally huge objectives. There are in fact a variety of very useful technologies which are&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Yavor Georgiev - Using WCF with Silverlight 3.0
video:video.video:description: WCF (Windows Communication Foundation), provides a clean way to develop connected, service-oriented applications using the .NET Framework. Yavor Georgiev joins us in this episode to show us more&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Yochay Kiriaty - Windows 7 Developer Training Kit
video:video.video:description: Windows 7 introduces some new UI enhancements, as well as a few additional features that developers should be looking at incorporating into their applications. Yochay Kiriaty joins us to talk about he&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Phil Haack - ASP.NET, MVC, and Ninjas On Fire
video:video.video:description:
Phil Haack had a session at MIX09 who's name caught my eye: &quot;ASP.NET MVC Ninjas on Fire Black Belt Tips&quot;, which I suppose was part of the intent.
I asked Phil to drop by and share with us&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Scott Hanselman - NerdDinner.com
video:video.video:description: Scott Hanselman did an interesting session at MIX09 called &quot;File|New -&gt; Company&quot;, where he essentially started with a blank screen, and using Visual Studio, ASP.NET, Ajax, and Model View&#8230;

video:video.video:description: Virtual Earth continues to evolve and support a very robust programming model which allows developers to create unique and interesting mapping applications. One of the most recent developments is that&#8230;

video:video.video:description: Recently, Mark Wilson-Thomas did some sessions at MIX09 in which he provided details and demos of how Visual Studio 2010 will provide better support for rich development of WPF and Silverlight&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Tim Aidlin - Glimmer, a JQuery Interactive Design Tool

video:video.video:description: Social Networking remains one of the key features that helps to not only drive a sense of &quot;community&quot; amongst web users, but also helps to drive visits to sites. In this episode, I meet&#8230;

video:video.video:description: Stephen Walther is preparing two great talks for MIX09 which illustrate some of the new features of ASP.NET 4.0. We were able to spend a little time with him and discussed a couple of the things&#8230;

video:video.video:title: Joe Fletcher Touch and Gesture Computing
video:video.video:description: Joe Fletcher works in the Surface team, and is focused on identifying design approaches which best utilize touch-based interfaces for both Surface as well as Windows 7. In this episode we will&#8230;
